## Your Mission {.smaller}

Answer the following question using the data provided:

::: {style="text-align: center; font-size: 1.1em; padding-top: 100px;"}
Was there a [**meaningful**]{.brand-triad-blue-red} difference in [**ultra-processed food consumption**]{.brand-triad-blue-red} among Brazilian children aged [**2 to 4**]{.brand-triad-blue-red} years in [**2022**]{.brand-triad-blue-red} across [**clusters B and D**]{.brand-triad-blue-red} of the Revised Multidimensional Index for Sustainable Food Systems ([MISFS-R](https://doi.org/10.1002/sd.2376))?
:::

::: {.notes}
:::

## MISFS-R Clusters {.smaller}

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column style="width: 50%; font-size: 0.95em;"}
The Multidimensional Index for Sustainable Food Systems (MISFS) is a tool designed to assess the sustainability of [food systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Food_system) at a subnational level in Brazil, incorporating local behaviors and practices.

The **MISFS-R** is a revised version that introduces new indicators and a refined methodology for calculating the index.

For more details, see @carvalho2021a and @norde2023.
:::
::: {.column style="width: 50%; padding-top: 0px;"}

## Steps {.smaller}

üë£ Here are the steps you should follow:

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column style="width: 47.5%; font-size: 0.9em;"}
1\. Create a new project and open it in [Positron](https://positron.posit.co).

2\. Download the [Quarto](https://quarto.org) [template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/danielvartan/r-course/refs/heads/main/qmd/template.qmd), rename it as `index.qmd`, and store it in the project root.

3\. Download the template [references file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/danielvartan/r-course/refs/heads/main/qmd/references.bib), name it as `reference.bib` and store it in the project root.

4\. Read and review the Quarto template.

5\. Perform an **a priori** power analysis.

6\. Download the data.

7\. Inspect the data file.
:::
::: {.column style="width: 5%;"}
:::
::: {.column style="width: 47.5%; font-size: 0.9em;"}
8\. Import the data into R.

9\. Clean, tidy, and validate the data.

10\. Transform the data as needed.

11\. Save the validated data.

12\. Conduct a **brief** exploratory data analysis.

13\. Conduct a t-test to compare the group means.

14\. Calculate and assess the effect size.

15\. Write your conclusions.

16\. Render the report.
:::
::::
